snippet: On his second tour as governor of California, Jerry Brown has succeeded in ways few would have imagined when he took office in 2010.
abstract: California Governor Jerry Brown has succeeded in his second tour as governor in ways many thought impossible; Brown is the dominant politician in the state, strengthened by overwhelming Democratic control of the Legislature and the decline of the Republican Party, and has pushed through major initiatives on education financing and prison reorganization; Brown's re-election, should he run, seems almost assured.
lead_paragraph: On his second tour as governor of California, Jerry Brown has succeeded in ways few would have imagined when he took office in 2010.

headline.main: Brown Cheered in Second Act, at Least So Far
headline.print_headline: Brown Cheered In Second Act, At Least So Far
